result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Barry M Budris

records.addlTxt: DE's copy of 9/23/2022 Competency Hearing Notice returned; unable to forward
Pre-trial conference on November 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Barry M Budris in court.  Attorney Laura Breun in court for Barry M Budris.  Attorney Annie Jay in court for State of Wisconsin. Dr. Engen's report concludes defn meets the standards for legal competency. Colloquy w/ Atty Breun. Colloquy w/ defn; defn does not believe he is competent. Witness Dr. Christina Engen duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by ADA Jay. CT receives 8/23 Competency Report as evidence for this hearing. Cross exam by Atty Breun. Redirect exam by ADA Jay. Witness excused at 11:13 am. Argument by ADA Jay. Argument by Atty Breun. CT makes findings and finds defn is legally competent. Bail cont.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Competency hearing on September 23, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Barry M Budris in court.  Attorney Laura Breun in court for Barry M Budris.  Attorney Annie Jay in court for State of Wisconsin. Dr. Engen unavailable. CT reschedules CH. Notice of hearing handed out in court.
Competency hearing on September 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Dr. Engen
Copy of order for competency exam sent electronically to Dane County Conditional Release Program.
Defendant in court with Attorney Laura Breun.  Annie Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Breun raises competency. CT orders competency evaluation. Notice of hearing handed out in court.
Competency hearing on August 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
and returned.
Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol.
Arguments heard by both parties.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

01:50 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Laura Breun.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Barry M Budris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Filed by Atty Breun
Atty Breun appointed

Per Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS) violation report, Court orders bench warrant issued. 
If the Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCPS. If the Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCPS is required to enforce conditions of release and the Defendant shall report to DCPS by 10:00 a.m. on the business day following release from jail. All other bail conditions remain set.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: Warrant Authorized
DCPS Informational Report - defendant reported to DCPS
DCPS Informational Report
Zoom
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 5
02:28 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Richard Lance Jones.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties by Zoom. Stipulation by parties.
Per DCPS violation report, Court orders body-only bench warrant.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: issue body-only bench warrant
